meanings.definition: To shrink back, as in fear or disgust.
meanings.sent1: She was cringing at the sight of the spider on the wall.
meanings.sent2: I cringed when I heard the loud thunder outside.
meanings.sent3: The cat was cringing away from the vacuum cleaner, thinking it was a monster.
meanings.sent4: The thought of public speaking made her cringe like a turtle retreating into its shell.
meanings.sent5: The sound of nails on a chalkboard made everyone cringe in discomfort.

meanings.sent1: His cringing expression revealed his unease at the situation.
meanings.sent2: She gave a cringing smile when she realized her mistake.
meanings.sent3: The cringing puppy hid behind the couch after knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The cringing student avoided eye contact with the teacher after failing the test.
meanings.sent5: The cringing audience watched as the comedian's jokes fell flat.

meanings.definition: A feeling of embarrassment or disgust.
meanings.sent1: The cringing in her stomach told her she had made a big mistake.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't hide the cringing on his face when he saw the embarrassing video.
meanings.sent3: The cringing in the room was palpable after the awkward comment.
meanings.sent4: Her cringing was evident as she recounted the embarrassing moment.
meanings.sent5: The cringing in the air was thick as the embarrassing story unfolded.
